content: grandmother s favorite dishcloth with neat slip-stitched edges gina lynette s take on a traditional favorite row 4 s1pw k2 yo k across repeat row 4 until you have 50 stitches on the needle this will make a cloth about 8 square you can make it whatever size you want a small 5 square stop at 35 stitches and call it a wipe huge go until you have 200 stitches on the needles and call it a baby blanket using a specific amount of yarn leave slightly more than half to do the decreases decreasing row 5 s1pw k1 k2tog yo k2tog k across repeat row 5 until you have 7 stitches on the needle yes the last time through you will be this is my variation of a very old pattern knitting together the yo from the previous row i like a slip_stitch edge so i sussed out a and a k stitch together pattern with one the nice thing about this row 6 s1pw k2tog k across pattern is that you only have to pay attention repeat row 6 until you have 3 stitches on the for about the first 4 or 5 stitches of each row needle then you can daydream watch tv read a book or chat with a friend two endings yarn worsted or aran cotton - 35g for 8 square if you want a needles size 7 4 5 mm hanging loop insert a 4 5 mm crochet hook through all three stitch abbreviations loops from the side opposite of the yarn remove k = knit  s1pw = slip 1 stitch purlwise the knitting needle and snug the three loops onto kfb = knit front & back  yo = yarn over k2tog = knit the next 2 stitches together knitwise the crochet hook yo and pull through all three loops chain 15 and attach to the corner with a pattern slip_stitch finish off and weave in ends increasing if you don t want a hanging loop cut off the cast on 3 stitches yarn leaving a 6 tail thread the yarn through a row 1 s1pw kfb k 4 st tapestry needle and pull the thread through all row 2 s1pw k kfb k 5 st three loops remove the knitting needle pull the row 3 s1pw k2 kfb k 6 st yarn snug finish off and weave in your ends ©2014 gina lynette  a la lynette  www ginalynette com
